title: Overview of Quadrant System
text: Quadrant I consists points where $$x$$ and $$y$$ are greater than $$0$$. Quadrant II consists points where $$x>0$$ and $$y<0$$. Quadrant III consists points where $$x$$ and $$y$$ are less than $$0$$. Quadrant IV consists points where $$x>0$$ and $$y<0$$.
speech: Quadrant I consists points where  x  and  y  are greater than  0 . Quadrant II consists points where  x is greater than 0  and  y, is less than 0 . Quadrant III consists points where  x  and  y  are less than  0 . Quadrant IV consists points where  x is greater than, 0  and  y, is less than 0 .

title: Determining Quadrant of $$(-4,2)$$
text: $$x=-4<0$$ and $$y=1>0$$. Following the details given in the previous step, the point is in quadrant II.
